definition: to steam again/to rewarm food in a bamboo steamer/to withdraw currency from circulation
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery
to go back to sleep (instead of rising up in the morning)/to sleep in

sentences.english: Return of capital has become more important than return on capital.
sentences.chinese: 回籠資金已變得比資本回報率更重要了。

sentences.english: I'm lucky that I didn't miss my final exam after having 30 minutes of unprotected sleep.
sentences.chinese: 我真走運，睡了30分鐘的回籠覺還沒錯過期末考試。

sentences.english: What are these that fly along like clouds, like doves to their cotes ?
sentences.chinese: 那些象雲彩飛來，象鴿子回籠的是誰？

sentences.english: To organise the whole sales team to support the project managers to achieve the collection of receivables .
sentences.chinese: 組織整個銷售團隊協助項目經理回籠資金。

sentences.english: Price increments until stable positions, single back to active layout.
sentences.chinese: 價穩持倉量續遞增，多單回籠積極佈局。

sentences.english: So I often ask for help from suppliers to tide me over until I recall the part of currency issued.
sentences.chinese: 因此我經常請求供應商幫忙擺脫困境直到資金回籠。

definition: to rotate/to circulate (cash, stock etc)/turnover/circulation/cash flow
